title: Audio Captioning Evaluation Task V0.1.2
description:
Please listen to the audio samples below. For EACH caption option, rate it on Accuracy, Richness, and Overall Quality based on the guidelines on the sidebar.

üîí Data Privacy Notice: This session does not collect any personally identifiable information (PII). All demographic data is anonymized and used solely for aggregate statistical analysis.

guideline_sections.title: Task Overview
guideline_sections.content:
Listen to the audio clip and rate the text caption on a 1‚Äì5 scale across three independent dimensions.

  • Primary Anchors: Use 1, 3, 5.
  • Secondary Anchors: Use 2, 4 only for clear in-between cases.

guideline_sections.title: 1. Accuracy
guideline_sections.content:
Definition: Factual correctness (Emotion, events, speaker attributes).

Scoring:

  • 5 (Accurate): All core info correct.
  • 3 (Mostly Accurate): Core correct, minor errors (gender/age/intensity).
  • 1 (Hallucination): Contradicts audio (wrong polarity/event).

Key Rules: Wrong emotion polarity = 1. adjacent emotion (angry vs furious) = 3-4.

guideline_sections.title: 2. Richness
guideline_sections.content:
Definition: Specificity of acoustic details (Pitch, Tempo, Volume, Noise).

Scoring:

  • 5 (Rich): 2+ correct distinct features.
  • 3 (Moderate): 1 correct feature or generic.
  • 1 (Poor): No meaningful detail.

guideline_sections.title: 3. Overall Quality
guideline_sections.content:
Definition: Naturalness, fluency, and balance.

Scoring:

  • 5 (Excellent): Natural & informative.
  • 3 (Acceptable): Understandable but generic/stiff.
  • 1 (Unusable): Ungrammatical or misleading.

Rule: If Accuracy=1, usually Quality ‚â§ 2.

guideline_sections.title: Appendix: Quick Logic
guideline_sections.content:
1. Check Accuracy: Wrong event? -> Score 1.
  2. Check Details: Correct acoustic features? (2+ = Score 5).
  3. Final Quality: High Acc + Bad Grammar = 3.
